title: Formula
text: The yield sign is typically in the shape of an equilateral triangle, where all three sides are equal. In this case, the length of each side is $$30$$ inches. To find the area of an equilateral triangle, we use the formula: $$\frac{s^2 \sqrt{3}}{4}$$, where s is the length of one side.

title: Substitution
text: What will you plug in for s in the equation?
